availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: George H. Wheeler (Mason County, KY, carriage maker and soldier - 11th Ky Cav)

body.p: Mason County, Kentucky, carriage maker and soldier. Mason County, Kentucky, native. Son of Conrad Wheeler and Katharine Wheeler. Married to Awilda Oliver Wheeler. Father of Elizabeth L. Wheeler. Attended school in Mason County, Kentucky, in 1850. Carriage maker in Mason County in 1860. Served in the 10th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a first lieutenant from September 9, 1862, to September 17, 1863. Served in the 11th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a captain from March 9, 1864, to July 17, 1865.

ab.bibl:

Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers Who Served in Organizations From the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 104.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers Who Served in Organizations From the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 113.
"George H. Wheeler," Daily Evening Bulletin (Maysville, Kentucky), November 6, 1882, p. 3.
